Born on a sweltering summer day in June 1981, Paris Whitney Hilton burst onto the scene like a confetti-filled piñata on steroids. Raised in a sprawling Beverly Hills mansion with a Walk of Fame-worthy address, Paris was destined for greatness. Her grandfather, Conrad Hilton, founded the Hilton Hotels empire, so it's no surprise she had a suite of perks and a never-ending supply of designer handbags.

After dropping out of high school (because, honestly, what's the point?), Paris turned her focus to partying, modeling, and making waves on the celebrity circuit. She became a ubiquitous presence at nightclubs, red-carpet events, and, of course, the occasional Kardashian-Jenner family gathering. Her reality TV show, "The Simple Life," catapulted her to international fame, and she leveraged that momentum to launch a string of best-selling fragrances, fashion lines, and a 17-album discography (mostly electronic dance music).

In her downtime, Paris loves to indulge in lavish vacations, boutique shopping sprees, and – allegedly – practicing yoga on the beach with her loyal entourage. She's an ardent supporter of various animal welfare organizations and philanthropic causes, but mostly because it looks fabulous on Instagram.

Today, Paris Hilton is a household name, with a net worth estimated to be in the tens of millions. She's been named one of the most influential people in the world, according to Time Magazine (okay, it was 2004, but still). As an heiress, entrepreneur, and international icon, Paris has earned her place as one of the most recognizable – and, arguably, most Instagrammable – personalities on the planet.
